text: when we first went to AWS we actually
built things the same way and we
realized that that wasn't going to be
sustainable going forward so we wanted
to move into you know more modern design
patterns for example we have invoices
that we generate in our Erp system we
would take one copy of that and send it
to our customer website we would take
another copy send it to our risk
management system that's why we decided
to go to more event driven type
architecture it's grown very quick when
we first went to our event bus within a
couple months we had you know 50 or so
consumers already as of today we have
about 500 over the last few years so the
change to AWS and event driven
architecture has allowed us to give
people value quicker in the past for
some of our processes we could only get
them the data maybe once a day once we
went to event-driven architecture we can
provide them you know information on
their data Within minutes of it being
generated with our event-driven
architecture and our focus on serverless
has made us case able to be more agile
for example we recently needed to
request to build a new mobile app for
our customers and in the past that could
have would have taken months before we
could even show them a demo but because
we had some of these Services already
built and then we could reuse it we were
actually able to show our business a
proof of concept within two weeks we
have a big focus on using AWS serverless
products the cost for it is very
minuscule compared to what it would take
to to run an actual server so it gives
us a lot of agility and then we're also
not having to maintain it and and spend
a lot of support on the underlying
infrastructure
[Music]
